page.title: 11THE ROYAL BRITISH LEGION
page.content: Originally called the COMMONWEALTH ASSOCIATION,when it began in 1919,it became{THE ROYAL BRITISH LEGION}in 1921.It was in June of that same year that the LULWORTH Branch was started. This association helps Ex Servicemen and women,when they leave the Forces. It also gives aid to widows and their dependents. A CLUB was formed in 1951.It is open every day at lunch time and in the evening.The 400 members (140 ladies) raise money for the British Legion Charities.Their main charity is the Earl Haig Poppy Appeal Fund. The longest living member is MR CECIL BAVERSTOCK,who joined in 1931,he still has his first membership card! We are grateful to MRS SHIRLEY HALLETT,(Standard Bearer for the Lulworth Branch) for the information given on this page.
